metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000085 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ClamAV version version 0.99.3 contains a Out of bounds heap memory read vulnerability in XAR parser, function xar_hash_check() that can result in Leaking of memory, may help in developing exploit chains.. This attack appear to be exploitable via The victim must scan a crafted XAR file. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit d96a6b8bcc7439fa7e3876207aa0a8e79c8451b6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> not included in final 0.99.3 release

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
